action.action-desc: Ms. Tenney (for herself, Mr. Tonko, Mr. Lawler, and Mr. Ryan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude certain discharges of indebtedness secured by real property from income.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Saving Our Mainstreet American Locations for Leisure and Shopping Act of 2025, or the Saving Our MALLS Act.

section.header: Excluding discharge of commercial or retail indebtedness from income

subsection.text: Section 108(a)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking or at the end of subparagraph (D), by striking the period at the end of subparagraph (E)(ii) and inserting , or, and by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: the indebtedness discharged is qualified commercial or retail indebtedness.

subsection.text: Section 108 of such code is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: The term qualified commercial or retail indebtedness means indebtedness which is—

subparagraph.text: incurred or assumed by the taxpayer before March 1, 2023,
discharged during the period beginning on December 31, 2023, and ending on January 1, 2028, and
secured directly or indirectly by specified real property of the taxpayer at all times after such indebtedness was so incurred or assumed and before such discharge.

paragraph.text: The term specified real property means real property which is—

subparagraph.text: used in a trade or business of the taxpayer,

paragraph.text: Section 108(a)(2)(A) of such Code is amended by striking and (E) and inserting (E), and (F).

subparagraph.text: in the header, by striking and qualified real property business exclusion and inserting , qualified real property business exclusion, and qualified commercial or retail indebtedness, and
by striking and (D) and inserting (D), and (F).

subsection.text: Section 108(b)(1) is amended by striking or (C) and inserting (C), or (F).
The amendments made by this section apply to discharges of indebtedness occurring on or after December 31, 2023.
